title: Cat. 78.2  Manao tupapau (She Thinks of the Ghost or The Ghost Thinks of Her, 1894/95, printed 1928
publication_title: Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Printed by Georges-Daniel de Monfreid (1856–1929)  
Manao tupapau (She Thinks of the Ghost or The Ghost Thinks of Her)  
1894/95, printed 1928  
Wood-block print in black ink on cream Japanese paper; 173 × 127 mm (image); 250 × 178 mm (sheet)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of Carl O. Schniewind, 1948.394  
Guérin 40, Kornfeld 30.3 A.b  
For the verso, see fig. 78.2.1

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">Given by Mr. and Mrs. Carl O. Schniewind (1900–1957), Chicago, to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1948.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints, with assistance of Christine E. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988), pp. 138–40, cat. 30.

Henri Dorra, The Symbolism of Paul Gauguin: Erotica, Exotica, and the Great Dilemmas of Humanity (University of California Press, 2007), pp. 219–21, 239, fig. 113 (ill.).

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section other_documentation" id="other_documentation">Inscribed lower center, in graphite: ô no

</section><section epub:type="footnotes" id="footnotes">This was carved on the verso of the wood block used for Manao tupapao (cat. 77).

</section><section id="figures">Cat. 78.2 Manao tupapau (She Thinks of the Ghost or The Ghost Thinks of Her, 1894/95, printed 1928.

fig. 78.2.1 Verso of Gauguin’s Manao tupapau (She Thinks of the Ghost or The Ghost Thinks of Her) (1894/95). The Art Institute of Chicago, 1948.394.

</section>
